data.title: Question - About Dependancies?
data.body:
Hello,

Looking over the package.json at what I'm assuming here are dependencies this installs or builds against, can someone please tell me?

I hope Atom doesn't need to have all of these installed just for an editor, because that is really scary looking... :(

thank you

data.title: Hangs creating cursors
data.body:
1. Open a file in the react editor.
2. Hold down `ctrl-shift-down` to create a bunch of new cursors
3. Starts lagging around line 20
4. Freezes around line 40

Does not seem to happen in the old editor.

![screen shot 2014-06-17 at 5 43 18 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/3308527/d0d52ee6-f681-11e3-9150-2d00fc3eeacb.png)

data.title: Cursor gets messed up when changing font with editor hidden
data.body:
I was tweaking the font with an editor open behind the settings view and when I switched back to the editor the cursor got messed up.

I couldn't reproduce this with the old editor.

![font-change](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/3308355/1e595b02-f67c-11e3-8d6a-d41df3d657bf.gif)

data.title: Cursor loses gutter highlight at end of file
data.body:
This only happens with the react editor, create a couple cursors, move them both to the end of the file, the cursor is no longer highlighted in the gutter.

![line-highlight](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/3307977/845168f8-f674-11e3-9f7c-e29d27d7d1e9.gif)

data.title: Events in different order
data.body:
In the old editor the `Editor` emitted a `screen-lines-changed` before the `EditorView` emitted an `editor:display-updated`.

This seems to have changed in the React editor and is causing issues with packages that were relying on this order such as the bracket matcher.

Also `editor:display-updated` seems to be firing 3 times more with the React editor vs. the old editor when soft wrapped lines are updated.

![screen shot 2014-06-17 at 3 51 31 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/3307823/18918352-f672-11e3-82fc-d2c9289787b9.png)

data.title: Create method for packages to provide assets
[ bracket not appearing on Windows (AZERTY)
data.body:
When I type `[`, it doesn't appear in the text editor.
`]` works fine.

Tested on release 104, Windows 8.1 Update 1 x64, clean (removed .atom directory), keyboard layout azerty.

data.title: Clicking gutter doesn't change selection
data.body: Clicking and shift-clicking in the gutter doesn't seem to change the selection in the React editor.

data.title: Editor hangs when cycling through autocompletions
data.body:
1. Open a `package.json` file with around 50 lines.
2. Toggle the autocomplete view with no prefix
3. Hold the down arrow to cycle through the completions.

Editor starts lagging after a few seconds and canceling it takes around 5 seconds. This does not happen with the old editor.

Please let me know if you have trouble reproducing this and I can post a gif.

data.title: End of line fold icons don't show
data.body:
### Old Editor

![screen shot 2014-06-17 at 1 56 04 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/3306519/d6db187a-f661-11e3-812a-22b204893ec2.png)
### React Editor

![screen shot 2014-06-17 at 1 56 34 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/3306528/e6f0abd0-f661-11e3-8a48-2b6f6d08a450.png)

data.title: Shift+Command+LeftArrow opens web console when using panes
data.body:
This is a reoccuring issue for me (but I cannot reproduce at will).  I'm using OSX.
Normally, when the cursor is at the end of the line, shift+command+leftarrow will select the entire line (from the cursor to the start of the line).  When I perform this keyboard shortcut in one buffer with 2 panes open it often causes the Javascript dev console and debugger in the bottom of the application, and keyboard shortcuts to move around fail to work.

I'd love to provide more info on what is admittedly a very small edge case.  It has happened several times spanning many versions.  I'm currently using 0.103.0 on OSX 10.9.3.  I do not believe any packages are involved (I am using the standard Panes; split right, once).  I'll try to provide a screenshot if I can.

data.title: Wrong markdown preview
data.body:
The preview shown is not correct, see the headers:

![captura de pantalla de 2014-06-17 14 54 32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6054951/3304246/84f880ec-f648-11e3-869a-e9285934bad4.png)

The line below the first level header is shown below the second level header instead.

data.title: Can not build atom again
data.body:
Used x32 version. Decided to build Atom x64. Deleted Atom directory in program files, Documents, deleted local repo and directories in AppData. Installed win SDK, Node x64. Spent a whole day but without success -- built failed. In the evening i gave up and decided to build x32 again. At least it worked. Installed Node x32 again and run script\build. However this time build finished, but i found nothing in Program Files and AppData. Tried two or three times more -- result was the same. Noticed that grunt was not executed. Run script\grunt -- it failed and produced nothing.

If necessary, i'll be able to send any additional info on June 20 or June 21.

data.title: Install Atom.desktop when installing to /usr/local
data.body:
Fixes #1969
Running `sudo script/grunt install` also installs a desktop-file for atom in `/usr/share/applications`

data.title: Smaller Windows build
data.body:
This reduces the built `.zip` file from ~100MB to ~65MB.

Previously the ignored paths weren't properly being escaped so they weren't matching any of the paths.

Also I added ignoring of `build/Release/obj` and `build/Release/*.pdb` similar to the `build/Release/obj.target` ignore that was already done on Mac OS X.

Fixes #2624

data.title: Adding BUILD_DIR environment variable
data.body: Adding **BUILD_DIR** environment variable to **tmpDir**, necessary in package generation for Slackware and others distros who need maintain an specified build directory.

data.title: Fix packages specs on Windows CI
data.body:
This updates the remaining failing specs to pass on the Windows CI machine.

Unfortunately I still don't know why they failed, they passed on both my Windows 8 vm and on a Windows 8 Samsung Ultrabook.

So instead the specs were massaged a bit to get them passing consistently but functionally be the same.

data.title: Handle mousedown events only for left button in editors
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2350

This adds a check to the classic and react editor so that mousedown events are handled only for the left mouse button. Currently, handling events for the right mouse button causes selections to be canceled after a right click.

cc @nathansobo

data.title: 32-bit version takes ages to load
data.body:
I installed Atom 32bit via the [Webupd8 PPA](http://www.webupd8.org/2014/06/atom-text-editor-available-for-linux.html) and it takes forever to load.

It shows quite a bit of lag in normal use too (just typing plain text)

OS: elementary 0.2 (Luna)

data.title: Investigate Windows zip size
data.body: It appears to be ~30MB larger than the mac zip, would be good to investigate why that is.

data.title: Unwanted automatic line breaks at end of file after saving file
data.body:
Automatic Line Breaks at end of file after saving file.
#### PHP :

Its very bad for PHP files, as most of PHP files ends with `?>` and Atom is appending line break `\n` after `?>`

Atom Version 0.103.0 (0.103.0)

data.title: text-rendering: optimizeLegibility causes erratic caret behaviour
data.body:
Hi all,

If I apply the ‘text-rendering: optimizeLegibility’ directive to the stylesheets on .editor or .workspace, any subsequent command palettes, text fields or tabs have a visually broken/erratic caret:
- In text fields, such as the command palette or settings view, the caret appears before the first character even though it's actually pointing to the end of the text;
- Moving the caret left and right in an editor tab sometimes causes it to jump several places left and right of where it should be, there doesn't seem to be any discernible pattern and reloading the tab causes different breakages to happen.

This issue only affects new tabs/palettes created after the stylesheet change occurs, it seems.  Similarly, removing the stylesheet change only takes effect for new tabs/palettes.

I'm running Atom HEAD on Gentoo Linux, 64-bit, not using the react editor.

Not sure which part of Atom this applies to, so I've filed it against atom/atom (sorry!)

data.title: automatic reporting of config, active packages for bugs
data.body:
I like helping to squash all those little :bug: but it's a little cumbersome to always gather all the config data and currently enabled packages to file a good bug report (especially since it's often unclear which package or combination thereof is at fault).

Any chance we can get a feature in atom to automatically save said info to the clipboard?

data.title: unable to select, advance cursors to end of line
data.body:
This is odd:

![md-bug-2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5372770/3281957/b5a09f3a-f4cd-11e3-8b38-3fb11de0811d.gif)

I can't advance by arrow keys towards the end of the line I am in.
I also can't click there or select (my frantic mouse movements are indicating that I'm trying).

I'm running:
- OS X 10.9.3
- Atom 0.103.0
- 2 Panes at the same time
- softwrap fixed at 80
- not sure which other package might be relevant.

This might be a duplicate/related to #1894 and also atom/markdown-preview#92

data.title: added delete to end of line
data.body:
This adds a command to delete text to the end of the line, without modifying the clipboard. This is the behavior in Sublime Text and what I was used to.

I'm not sure how to run the tests (`npm test` throws a whole bunch of weird errors unrelated to this commit). Perhaps someone familiar with this can run them, and/or tell me how to, in case I need to fix something? It does have the behavior I expected using it on my own.

data.title: Menu bar is not displayed correctly in full screen mode
data.body:
Built Atom for x32 systems. Have win7 x64 (home basic).
Have a trouble with displaying menubar in fullscreen mode. When i press 'alt' key -- i see no menu bar -- only small lines on the top.
Attaching a screenshot:
![menubug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6533582/3280721/ba02b4e6-f478-11e3-9b29-8f6dd103a23e.png)

data.title: added delete to end of line
data.body:
Hey guys, I wanted to add the ability to delete to the end of the line, but not cut (i.e. not modify the clipboard). This is the behavior that `Ctrl-K` has in Sublime Text, and what I'm used to.

~~these changes did not work for me~~ They work now! So consider this a legit pull req :)

data.title: React editor grey on start
data.body:
When starting Atom, it restores the tabs that were open on the last run. If the last active tab was an editor view, the whole atom window renders blank light grey, except for the menubar. This doesn't happen if Atom starts into e.g. the settings view and then I switch to an editor tab. Also this only happens with the React editor enabled. Resizing the window or reloading with ctrl+alt+r makes the content visible again.

Maybe it's something about the window dimensions not updating early enough and that causing confusion in the React editor? Just a guess, though.

I'm on Arch Linux 64-bit, Atom built from the latest master (46e1a9254d) with no additional plugins or settings. Other than this bug, the new React editor seems to perform very well.

data.title: Fix build instructions by adding `./`
